title: cwtCensus
text: Read data. Load source release data memory read.csv reader functions. source data set used . Process coded-wire tag information. now start find total number number releases production expansion factor using source data. Production expansion factor defined number tagged fish clipped adipose fin / number total releases. Extract time produce final data frame required column names. final result.
code: release_custom <- read.csv("./sample_releases.csv") release_custom$cwt_1st_mark_count[is.na(release_custom$cwt_1st_mark_count)] <- 0 release_custom$cwt_2nd_mark_count[is.na(release_custom$cwt_2nd_mark_count)] <- 0 release_custom$non_cwt_1st_mark_count[is.na(release_custom$non_cwt_1st_mark_count)] <- 0 release_custom$non_cwt_2nd_mark_count[is.na(release_custom$non_cwt_2nd_mark_count)] <- 0  release_custom$Total_Released <- (release_custom$cwt_1st_mark_count                            + release_custom$cwt_2nd_mark_count                            + release_custom$non_cwt_1st_mark_count                            + release_custom$non_cwt_2nd_mark_count)  release_custom$prod_exp <- release_custom$cwt_1st_mark_count / release_custom$Total_Released  names(release_custom)[7] <- "tag_code" release_custom <- release_custom |>    dplyr::mutate(release_month = lubridate::month(lubridate::ymd(last_release_date)),          total_release = Total_Released) |>    dplyr::select(release_month,          brood_year,          tag_code,          prod_exp,          total_release) release_custom |> colnames() #> [1] "release_month" "brood_year"    "tag_code"      "prod_exp"      #> [5] "total_release" release_custom |> head() #>   release_month brood_year tag_code  prod_exp total_release #> 1             6       2007    67001 0.2490268       1253793 #> 2             6       2007    68602 0.2499226       1779855 #> 3             6       2007    68603 0.2481118       1860859 #> 4             5       2008    68640 0.9778000        270000 #> 5             6       2008    68623 0.2484728        141110 #> 6             6       2008    68638 0.2498524       1601137

title: cwtCensus
text: release data frame belt, can use construct recovery data frame. example create . Read relevant data top release data frame, also need several sources information. need coded-wire tag recovery information, contains tag recovered. , need site code data frame translate recovery site id human readable regions. Lastly, need know minimum harvest size limit inches time location tag recovered. Note pieces information one data frame, combine three data frames. Combine relevant data frames required column names. final result.
code: recovery_custom = read.csv("./sample_recoveries.csv") site_code = read.csv("./sample_site_code.csv") size_limit = read.csv("./sample_size_limits.csv") site_code <- site_code |>   dplyr::mutate(sampling_site = sampsite,          location = area.1) |>   dplyr::select(sampling_site, location, agency)  size_limit <- size_limit |>   dplyr::mutate(location = Location,          month = Month,          size_limit = limit) |>   dplyr::select(-c('Month', 'Location', 'limit'))  recovery_custom <- recovery_custom |>    dplyr::mutate(month = lubridate::month(lubridate::ymd(recovery_date))) |>    dplyr::select(run_year,          recovery_id,          fishery,          tag_code,          sex,          month,          sampling_site,          recovery_location_code,          sampling_site,          reporting_agency,          estimated_number,          length) |>    dplyr::left_join(release, by = "tag_code") |>    dplyr::select(-c("release_month",             "prod_exp",             "total_release")) |>    dplyr::left_join(site_code, by = c("sampling_site" = "sampling_site",                               "reporting_agency" = "agency")) |>    dplyr::filter(fishery %in% c(10, 40, 54, 50, 46)) |>   dplyr::mutate(est_num = estimated_number) |>   dplyr::left_join(size_limit, by = c('run_year', 'fishery', 'location', 'month')) |>   dplyr::select("run_year",          "fishery",          "tag_code",          "length",          "sex",          "month",          "location",          "size_limit",          "est_num") recovery_custom |> colnames() #> [1] "run_year"   "fishery"    "tag_code"   "length"     "sex"        #> [6] "month"      "location"   "size_limit" "est_num" recovery_custom |> head() #>   run_year fishery tag_code length sex month location size_limit est_num #> 1     2009      50    67001    496   M    11     <NA>         NA    1.01 #> 2     2009      50    67001    497   M    11     <NA>         NA    1.01 #> 3     2009      50    67001    410   M    11     <NA>         NA    1.00 #> 4     2009      50    67001    505   M    11     <NA>         NA    1.00 #> 5     2010      10    67001    670         7       FB         27    1.97 #> 6     2010      10    67001    730         7       FB         27    1.57

title: cwtCensus
text: age-specific survival rate ratio survived individuals end age total individuals beginning age. Typically, survival rate age-2 cohort 0.5, rate age-3 0.8. create custom survival rate input.
code: survival_custom = data.frame(age = 2:6, rate = c(0.5, rep(0.8, times = 4)))  survival_custom #>   age rate #> 1   2  0.5 #> 2   3  0.8 #> 3   4  0.8 #> 4   5  0.8 #> 5   6  0.8

title: cwtCensus
text: package uses either bootstrapped data point estimates. Bootstrapped estimations allow us approximate spread parameters simulated uncertainties, point estimates deterministic. Simply put, bootstrapped estimations offer information point estimates. However, takes significantly computing cycles find bootstrapped estimations find point estimates.

previous_headings: How to Use the Function > Bootstrap or Point Estimate?
title: cwtCensus
text: model number fish missed sampling effort negative binomial distribution. Assuming negative binomial distribution models number failures kth success, number fish recovered 1+rnbinom(1,1/est_num)1 + rnbinom(1,  1/est\_num) est_num number fish estimated recovered one tag (point estimate).

title: cwtCensus
text: two types return value, depending values detail bootstrap. case detail bootstrap FALSE, return value data table following form: cases either detail, bootstrap, set TRUE, return value three dimensional list. first dimension encodes brood year information (), second age, third month. age age-specific summary information. month data month-specific summary information. Depending detail bootstrap, corresponding output vary. structure return value:

text: O’Farrell M, Mohr M, Grover , Satterthwaite W (2012). “Sacramento River Winter Chinook Cohort Reconstruction: Analysis Ocean Fishery Impacts.” NOAA Technical Memorandum. Salmon Technical Team (2021). “STT Recommendations Hooking Mortality Rates 2000 Recreational Ocean Chinook Coho Fisheries.” Pacific Fishersy Management Council, Portland. https://www.pcouncil.org/documents/2021/05/stt-recommendations--hooking-mortality-rates--2000-recreational-ocean-chinook--coho-fisheries.pdf/.

what: Efficient Population Analysis Tool for Cohort Reconstruction
title: Efficient Population Analysis Tool for Cohort Reconstruction
text: goal cwtCensus provide fast memory efficient tool cohort reconstruction using point bootstrapped estimates. Writing efficient code cohort reconstruction can challenging, developed cwtCensus abstract away details tweaking lines R designing algorithms. package, can generate bootstrapped non-bootstrapped cohort reconstructions just one click!

title: Efficient Population Analysis Tool for Cohort Reconstruction
text: can install latest stable version cwtCensus CRAN : can install development version cwtCensus GitHub :

title: Efficient Population Analysis Tool for Cohort Reconstruction
text: basic example showing solve common cohort reconstruction problem: Creating cohort reconstruction point estimates: Time spent generating point estimate cohort reconstruction: Viewing 1998 brood year age 3 cohort June: Creating bootstrapped cohort reconstruction 1000 iterations: Viewing bootstrapped summary 1998 brood year age 3 cohort June: Time spent generating bootstrapped cohort reconstruction 1000 iterations:
code: library(cwtCensus) set.seed(998784) result = cohort_reconstruct(release, recovery, birth_month = 4L,   bootstrap = FALSE, last_month = 12L, iter = 10L,   level = 0.95, detail = FALSE, sex = "both", verbose = FALSE) cohort_reconstruct(release, recovery, birth_month = 4L,   bootstrap = FALSE, last_month = 12L, iter = 10L,   level = 0.95, detail = FALSE, sex = "both", verbose = FALSE) |> system.time() #>    user  system elapsed  #>   0.290   0.007   0.297 result[result$by == 2007 & result$age == 3 & result$month == 6] |> unlist() #>              by             age           month ocean_abundance  #>        2007.000           3.000           6.000        7965.572 result = cohort_reconstruct(release, recovery, birth_month = 4L,   bootstrap = TRUE, last_month = 12L, iter = 1000L,   level = 0.95, detail = TRUE, sex = "both", verbose = FALSE) result[["2007"]][["3"]][["6"]][["summary"]] #>                  median     sd CrI_low CrI_high #> ocean_abundance 7927.95 279.29 7413.22   8499.8 #> impact             0.00   0.00    0.00      0.0 #> maturation         0.00   0.00    0.00      0.0 #> natural_mort     146.06   5.15  136.58    156.6 cohort_reconstruct(release, recovery, birth_month = 4L,   bootstrap = TRUE, last_month = 12L, iter = 1000L,   level = 0.95, detail = TRUE, sex = "both", verbose = FALSE) |> system.time() #>    user  system elapsed  #>  25.477   0.232  25.776

what: Conduct cohort reconstruction for populations with coded wire tags — cohort_reconstruct
title: Conduct cohort reconstruction for populations with coded wire tags — cohort_reconstruct
text: cohort_reconstruct uses released recovered coded wire tags calculate ocean  abundance population brood year age month. function  returns list outputs indexed brood year, age, month. element list  contains two elements, data summary. general, data segment contains  raw data cohort reconstruction, summary segment includes statistics  raw data. return value, see value section. Depending bootstrap detail flags set, data summary segments  may behave different ways. information, see details.

title: Conduct cohort reconstruction for populations with coded wire tags — cohort_reconstruct
code: cohort_reconstruct(   rel,   reco,   birth_month,   last_month = 12L,   fisheries = list(oc_rec = 40, oc_com = 10, esc_sp = 54, esc_hat = 50, riv_harv = 46),   size_at_age = length_at_age,   rel_mort = release_mort,   survival = survival_default,   d_mort = 0.05,   bootstrap = FALSE,   iter = 10L,   detail = FALSE,   min_harvest_rate = 0,   level = 0.05,   hpd = TRUE,   verbose = TRUE,   sex = "both" )

title: Conduct cohort reconstruction for populations with coded wire tags — cohort_reconstruct
text: rel Input data frame CWT releases columns order: "brood_year" Integer. birth year CWT batch. "total_release" Double. total number releases batch CWT. "prod_exp" Double. ratio number tagged fish total number  fish batch, .e., number tagged fish / batch size. "tag_code" type. identifier batch CWT release. reco Input data frame CWT recoveries columns order: "run_year" Integer. year CWT recovery. "month" Integer. month CWT recovery. "length" Double. length inches recovered fish. "tag_code" type. identifier recovered tag. "fishery" Double. identifier fishery tag recovered.  fisheries include river harvest, spawning ground escapement, hatchery  escapement, ocean recreational fishing, ocean commercial fishing. "location" Character. identifier location tag recovered. "size_limit" Double. minimum harvest limit (inclusive) inches recovered  tag's region date. "est_num" Double. estimated number fish tag represents. "sex" Character. biological sex recovered fish. birth_month Integer specifying birth month individuals data set. last_month Integer indicating last month, numeric form, counts toward  current run. variable separate late spawners current run early spawners  next run. default value 12L, meaning entire natural year counts toward current run. fisheries Named list associating type fishery unique identifier  release recovery data. Must contain following named elements: "oc_rec" Identifier recreational ocean fishery. default value 40. "oc_com" Identifier commercial ocean fishery. default value 10. "esc_sp" Identifier escapement spawning ground. default value 54. "esc_hat" Identifier escapement hatchery. default value 50. "riv_harv" Identifier river harvest. default value 46. size_at_age Data frame specifying mean standard deviation individual  body length age month. default data frame included package named length_at_age. following describes required columns order. "age" Integer. fishing age cohort. "month" Integer. month numeric form. instance, 3L March. "mean" Double. mean total body length inches. "sd" Double. standard deviation total body length inches. rel_mort Data frame specifying hook--release mortality rate due ocean fishing  region. Hook--release mortality rate proportion fish default  data frame included package named release_mort. following describes required columns order. "run_year" Integer. year CWT recovery. "fishery" type. identifier type fishery. "location" type. identifier location. "month" Integer. month CWT recovery. "rate" Double. release mortality rate timestep. provide convenience, set default hook--release mortality rate, regardless time location, 0.14 recreational fishery 0.26 commercial fishery (Salmon Technical Team 2021) .  default values used find matching record data frame . survival Data frame specifying age specific natural survival rates. default data  frame included package named survival_default.  following describes required columns order. "age" Numeric specifying age. "rate" Double specifying agely survival rate. d_mort Double indicating drop mortality fishery impact. Drop mortality  proportion fish encountered gear killed without brought vessel  intact. default value 0.05 (Salmon Technical Team 2021) . bootstrap Boolean indicating parametric bootstrapping conducted. bootstrap  set false, iter ignored. iter Numeric integer specifying number iterations parametric bootstrapping.  default value 1000. Note larger values require computing power memory. detail Boolean indicating reconstruction calculate breakdowns summary  information. min_harvest_rate Double specifying lower bound harvest rate considered cohort  reconstruction. Harvest rate ratio number harvestable individuals  size cohort. level Double 0 1 inclusive, specifying credible level credible intervals.  option matters bootstrap set TRUE. hpd Boolean indicating highest posterior density credible interval used.  FALSE, symmetric credible interval used. verbose Boolean indicating function print progress updates. verbose set  TRUE, function provide status updates. particularly useful conducting  bootstrapped cohort reconstruction large iterations high computing cost,  progress updates can instill sense confidence otherwise discouraged user. sex String specifying sex sexes consider. Must choose "male", "female",  "". , "male" shorthand sperm-producing individuals. "Female" shorthand  egg-producing individuals.

Depending detail bootstrap, corresponding output vary. structure return value:

text: use fishing age, year life, age captured tags. aging convention  starts age-1. Namely, soon fish born, first year life,  thus age-1. Accordingly, age size_at_age data frame use fishing age  well.

title: Conduct cohort reconstruction for populations with coded wire tags — cohort_reconstruct
text: Since detail bootstrap Boolean valued variables, four combinations. detail = True, bootstrap = True Provides results detailed summary statistics using bootstrapped data. detail = False, bootstrap = True Provides results cohort data using bootstrapped data. detail = True, bootstrap = False Provides results detailed summary statistics using point estimates. detail = False, bootstrap = True Provides results cohort data using point estimates.

title: Conduct cohort reconstruction for populations with coded wire tags — cohort_reconstruct
text: provided recovery data span entire life time stock, cohort reconstruction  may fail yield accurate information. sure provide complete cohort recovery data set.

title: Conduct cohort reconstruction for populations with coded wire tags — cohort_reconstruct
text: O'Farrell M, Mohr M, Grover , Satterthwaite W (2012). “Sacramento River Winter Chinook Cohort Reconstruction: Analysis Ocean Fishery Impacts.” NOAA Technical Memorandum. Salmon Technical Team (2021). “STT Recommendations Hooking Mortality Rates 2000 Recreational Ocean Chinook Coho Fisheries.” Pacific Fishersy Management Council, Portland. https://www.pcouncil.org/documents/2021/05/stt-recommendations--hooking-mortality-rates--2000-recreational-ocean-chinook--coho-fisheries.pdf/.

title: Conduct cohort reconstruction for populations with coded wire tags — cohort_reconstruct
code: # Bootstrapped (10 iterations) and detailed cohort reconstruction. result = cohort_reconstruct(rel = release, reco = recovery, birth_month = 8L,   last_month = 12L, bootstrap = TRUE, iter = 3L, detail = TRUE) #> Preparing data. #> Initiating cohort reconstruction. #> Cohort reconstruction complete.  # Bootstrapped (10 iterations) but not detailed cohort reconstruction. result = cohort_reconstruct(rel = release, reco = recovery, birth_month = 8L,   last_month = 12L, bootstrap = TRUE, iter = 3L, detail = FALSE) #> Preparing data. #> Initiating cohort reconstruction. #> Cohort reconstruction complete.  # Point estimated and detailed cohort reconstruction. result = cohort_reconstruct(rel = release, reco = recovery, birth_month = 8L,   last_month = 12L, bootstrap = FALSE, detail = TRUE) #> Preparing data. #> Initiating cohort reconstruction. #> Cohort reconstruction complete.  # Point estimated but no detailed cohort reconstruction. result = cohort_reconstruct(rel = release, reco = recovery, birth_month = 8L,   last_month = 12L, bootstrap = FALSE, detail = FALSE) #> Preparing data. #> Initiating cohort reconstruction. #> Cohort reconstruction complete.  # Setting `iter` to a non-zero number when `bootstrap` is `FALSE` doesn't affect the result.  result = cohort_reconstruct(rel = release, reco = recovery, birth_month = 8L,   last_month = 12L, bootstrap = FALSE, iter = 1000L, detail = FALSE) #> Preparing data. #> Initiating cohort reconstruction. #> Cohort reconstruction complete.

title: Length-at-age information — length_at_age

title: cwtCensus (development version)
text: Initial GitHub submission
